abstract: Two regulators confirm reports that their agencies had opened investigations into JPMorgan Chase’s trading debacle and said they were weighing whether it would reshape rules for Wall Street.
snippet: Two regulators confirm reports that their agencies had opened investigations into JPMorgan Chase’s trading debacle and said they were weighing whether it would reshape rules for Wall Street.
lead_paragraph: Federal regulators shed new light on their investigations into JPMorgan Chase’s multimillion-dollar loss, telling Congress that they were examining potential wrongdoing and weighing whether the bank’s trading debacle would reshape rules for Wall Street.

headline.main: At Hearing, Regulators Discuss JPMorgan Investigation

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
